title: convert words into digestive biscuits
content:
I’ve found this on [www.boingboing.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356/http:/www.boingboing.net/ "www.boingboing.net") and thought of you...

[http://bokstavskex.framtid.nu/agi.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356/http:/bokstavskex.framtid.nu/agi.asp "http://bokstavskex.framtid.nu/agi.asp")

enjoy

 [‹ need help with names of two fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356/http:/typophile.com/node/19757 "Go to previous forum topic") [I love a deal, You love a deal, We all love a deal... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356/http:/typophile.com/node/19724 "Go to next forum topic")
author: lore

comments.content: MMmmm. I’d eat the holes first.
I had a very productive day!

I protest – those aren’t Digestives, now if they did Jammy Dodgers to go with my cuppa we’d be talking.  
Tim

This is real dedication/foolishness  
 [http://avantgame.com/cookierolling.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356/http:/avantgame.com/cookierolling.htm "http://avantgame.com/cookierolling.htm")

_those aren’t Digestives_

Crumbs, Tim, put some Brie on it!
Technically speaking you’re right Tim, there’s something dodgy about the texture and colour but then again they may be Swedish digestives, what do we know...

Smörgåskex  
Why does it always sound like they have more fun than me, even when they’re just having a snack?  
Tim

:) sorry about the pedantry  
 [http://www.goteborgskex.se/domino/html/GK/Gkexhome.nsf/Produkter?OpenFra...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356/http:/www.goteborgskex.se/domino/html/GK/Gkexhome.nsf/Produkter?OpenFrameSet "http://www.goteborgskex.se/domino/html/GK/Gkexhome.nsf/Produkter?OpenFrameSet")

\> ... but then again they may be Swedish digestives, what do we know…

We know, because they know...

[http://www.andersonbutik.com/Merchant2/merchant.mv?page=AB/PROD/C14\_cook...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356/http:/www.andersonbutik.com/Merchant2/merchant.mv?page=AB/PROD/C14_cookies/1153 "http://www.andersonbutik.com/Merchant2/merchant.mv?page=AB/PROD/C14\_cookies/1153")

Cheers, Si (biscuit lover)

They appear to be what we call “crackers”:

[http://www.kraftfoods.com/redovalfarms/rof\_index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356/http:/www.kraftfoods.com/redovalfarms/rof_index.htm "http://www.kraftfoods.com/redovalfarms/rof\_index.htm")

Exactly!!!! Crackers!  
Now a REAL digestive looks more like this:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mcvorangecd_1_5127.jpg)
  
if you know what I mean...  
every biscuit aficionado can recognize an original mcvities, no matter what the Swedish say

those alphabet cookies are the sweet type you’d eat with your coffee or tea (though they’re really for kids). they aren’t the kind you put cheese on, though i suppose you could. i don’t think they’re sold anymore though, but here’s the package shot:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121025356im_/http:/typophile.com/files/abc-kex_5804.jpg)

ahhhhhhhhhhhh...I’m glad we have this behind us!  
Thanks for that, now we can go on with our lives.
